title: CBD tram delays: Services halted after emergency situation
text:
Trams travelling through the heart of the CBD are running again after a halt for an emergency situation involving a man on King William St.

The incident, which The Advertiser understands involved a man who collapsed after a medical episode, occurred just before 2.15pm on Thursday.

Tram services travelling in both directions, between Victoria Square and South Tce, were stopped for about 70 minutes.

The man, in his 50s, has been taken to Royal Adelaide Hospital.

Northbound traffic on King Williams St was down to one lane.

Residual delays can be expected as services return to normal, Adelaide Metro says.
description: Trams travelling through the heart of the CBD are running again after a 70-minute halt for an emergency situation involving a man on King William St.
